response: narrative=Stanley Hawkins, recently moved to the area and was paranoid about surveillance, went missing after leaving a friend's house near Culduthel Park, Inverness, and was last seen entering the nearby forest.

narrative=Stanley Hawkins, recently relocated to the area, was known for his paranoia about surveillance. He went missing after a visit to a petting zoo near a forest with his foster mother. His colleague, Michelle Stevens, reported him agitated before his disappearance. Authorities traced him five days later to Rosedene Court, Inverness, as he sought solitude from perceived scrutiny following a potential sighting on Hamilton Drive.

narrative=Stanley Hawkins was last seen near the forest adjoining his part-time job. A close friend reported he expressed paranoia about surveillance and had financial difficulties. Concern grew when he didn't show up at Culduthel Park, Inverness, as expected.
